page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY, BARMBY MOOR
page.content: LOCAL HISTORY.BARMBY MOOR FEAST, BARMBY MOOR WAR GRAVES Barmby Moor Feast always held first Thursday after July 10th & has been so since 1820, it now-a-days consists of a comic cricket match, sports, fancy dress parade, floats, carnival queen & retinue, the feast is spread over 4 days.The culmination being an open-air religous service held on the village green amidst the fairground equipment & stalls. The churchyard has a number of War Graves, countries represented, Canada, Australia,& New Zealand (R.A.F. serving members) these graves are the responsibility of the War Graves Commission. The people of Barmby Moor are rightly proud of the way they tend the graves for the Commission. Many people come from abroad to pay their respects, and revisit old friends.
